Leonardo da Vinci, a renowned artist and inventor, painted the Mona Lisa, arguably the most famous painting in the world. In addition to his artistic talents, Da Vinci had a keen interest in science, anatomy, engineering, and architecture. His notebooks contain sketches and ideas for inventions such as flying machines and armored vehicles.

BEGININSTRUCTION
What is Leonardo da Vinci famous for creating and what other fields was he interested in?

ENDINSTRUCTION

Leonardo da Vinci is famous for creating the Mona Lisa, which is widely regarded as the most renowned painting in the world. Beyond his artistic achievements, he had a profound interest in various fields such as science, anatomy, engineering, and architecture. His notebooks are filled with sketches and ideas for inventions like flying machines and armored vehicles, showcasing his innovative mind and broad intellectual curiosity.
